isis.stitle: International® MaxxForce™ 7 Engine Service Manual - Crankcase, Crankshaft, and Camshaft - Cleaning, Inspection, and Testing - Crankshaft Assembly

step1.para: Clean and inspect crankshaft and main bearings.
Clean crankshaft with a suitable solvent.

warning.para: To prevent personal injury or death, wear safety glasses with side shields. Limit compressed air pressure to 207 kPa (30 psi).

step1.para: Use a stiff nylon brush to clean oil passages in crankshaft. Loosen accumulated dirt, sludge, and deposits.
Flush oil passages with a suitable solvent.
Inspect crankshaft journals (main and connecting rod) for scratches, grooves, and scoring.
Inspect main bearings for scratches, grooves, scoring, pitting, and inconsistent coloring.

figure.caption: Measurement of crankshaft connecting rod journal

caution.para: To prevent engine damage, grind or install new crankshaft if journals exceed maximum out-of-round or taper specifications.
To prevent engine damage, do not rework bearings or bearing caps to reduce journal-to-bearing running clearances. Grind or install new crankshaft.

step1.para:
Use a 3-4 inch micrometer
to measure diameter of each journal (main and connecting rod). Measure each journal at two points 90° apart. Move micrometer over entire width of journal. If journal wear exceeds specifications , grind or replace crankshaft.
